title: How to write a novel in 15 days - Quora

response.answer_text: The best learning for such question is the Stephen King  Stephen King writes 2,000 words a day. You can, too (at least for 30 days). Heard the name ?? Yaa…. The one whose novels are renowned to be covered in hit Hollywood series. The feeling in writing the structure of the novel is the primmest. When you enforce a strict timeline on yourself, you’ll be too busy to wait for the exact moment of inspiration. It’s definitely possible Always remember write more than your limit, but it’s best to never dip below that. Then you’ll find yourself having to play catch-up, and that’s never fun. ‘Keep your eyes on the writing ’; ‘Be careful what you wish for, ’cause you just might get it’, ‘If you don’t know to which port you’re sailing, no wind is favorable.’ Image-Google

What I have to say on that regards is; BRAIN STORM IT - Just write write write- or should I say? spit it all out- -do not revise, do not do any analytical thinking. As a matter of fact, the least thinking you do while you’re brainstorming, the better off. Instincts are usually on point, so just speak up your mind in papers, and need not worry about a thing. Now, when you finish done with what you don’t even know what wrote. CUT & EDIT- then, you can get to what your instincts were dictating you to aim at a broader audience-
